DOC.brief_summary: The purpose study compare efficacy 7 % lidocaine / 7 % tetracaine cream 2,5 % lidocaine / 2,5 % prilocaine cream reduce self-reported pain single laser procedure treatment acne keloidalis nuchae tattoo removal .
DOC.brief_title: 7 % Lidocaine/7 % Tetracaine Cream Versus 2,5 % Lidocaine / 2,5 % Prilocaine Cream
DOC.detailed_description: In study compare efficacy 7 % lidocaine / 7 % tetracaine cream 2,5 % lidocaine / 2,5 % prilocaine cream reduce self-reported pain single laser procedure treatment acne keloidalis nuchae tattoo removal . Patients ask fill questionnaire : - ass severity pain experience ( VAS score ) laser treatment , - evaluate whether pain relief adequate , - evaluate amount money patient would willing pay cream provide 'best ' pain relief . One week visit patient telephone consultation . The patient ask experienced symptom , record adverse event .
DOC.criteria: • Subject provide write informed consent ; Subject ≥ 18 year age time screen ; Group A : subject acne keloidalis nucha ; Group B : subject uniform , black , professionally place tattoo • Known sensitivity component test material ; Pregnant breastfeed woman ; Use pain medication past 24 hour prior laser treatment ; Damaged skin designate treatment site ; Blister formation and/or scar formation testtreatment standard laser setting ; Any medical psychiatric condition , investigator 's opinion , would preclude participant adhere protocol complete study per protocol .
